item.title: Arbitrum-Based Liquidity Protocol Exploited For $7.5M | Coingape
item.dc:creator: Jai Pratap
item.description:
The Arbitrum-based Jimbos Protocol has been exploited for 4090 ETH worth $7.5 million three days after its version 2 launch. PeckShield reported the hack was enabled by the protocol’s lack of control over slippage for the tokens under its control. Hacker used $5.9 million flash loan to exploit Arbitrum-based protocol This hack is due to

The post Arbitrum-Based Liquidity Protocol Exploited For $7.5M appeared first on CoinGape.

item.title: Debt Ceiling Deal Reached “In Principle” To Avoid Default | Coingape
item.dc:creator: Jai Pratap
item.description:
US President Joe Biden and House Representative Kevin McCarthy have reached a deal in principle to raise the government’s $3.4 trillion debt ceiling days before the default deadline. The tentative agreement between the two parties would raise the debt limit for two years while limiting spending over that time. However, the deal still needs approval

item.title: Breaking: Binance To Suspend Crypto Services For Japan By November 30 | Coingape
item.dc:creator: Coingape Staff
item.description:
Crypto News: On Saturday, the world’s largest crypto exchange, Binance, announced the discontinuation of its crypto services for residents of Japan, effective November 30 2023. This decision was made as part of ongoing efforts by Binance to comply with regulatory standards and assure compliance in the countries the crypto giant operates. Upcoming  Binance Japan Launch
